column4: I know this is a question for #ubuntustudio but no one's really there. Does anyone know why networkmanager isn't installed by default on both the 8.10 and 9.04 Alpha 4 versions? Is it because the alternate install CD doesn't detect network hardware and so skips its install?
you're gonna have better luck trying #ubuntu+1 for that
here's where the file is that explains how to use wpasupplicant w/ /etc/network/interfaces: /usr/share/doc/wpasupplicant/README.modes.gz
